info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 4:23PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Ouray, northeastern San Miguel and south central Montrose Counties through 500 PM MDT... At 422 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles northwest of Loghill Village to 8 miles north of Sawpit. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Ouray, northeastern San Miguel and south central Montrose Counties. This includes Colorado 62 between mile markers 2 and 17. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
